Reviews.Title: A Worthwhile Purchase
Reviews.Author: Steve Hebert
Reviews.Content: This Camera (T3I) is very well reviewed so I will only cover a few highlights that mean something to me.Note: I've only had this for 4 weeks and have not explored it completely.This particular "bundle" that I got had the 55-250mm IS STM lens -  very happy with it, auto focus is very fast and completely silent., The battery grip is great.. a must have. Camera bag is pretty good. memory card is top of the line.The camera itself..The zoom feature in Video mode is awesome. With the 55-250 lens you definitely need a tripod. (Zooms in way more in video mode than just photo mode) From what I can see this feature is not available in the next model up.One drawback, no autofocus in video mode.  As far as I can see you have to auto focus before you start the video, or you can manually focus thruout the video. (I understand next model up can auto-focus in video mode)Camera with the 55-250 lens is very light (Compared to my old 35mm SLR) but does not feel cheap.Battery life (with double battery grip) appears more than enough for normal use. On a 5 hr hiking trip, camera was on all the time and took about 400 pictures, batteries were still pretty well charged up. Plus with the battery grip you get a second battery pack that holds 6 AA batteries. Great to keep that as a back up. (Doubt if I will ever use it)Overall we are very happy with it and am in the market for a second one (possibly used) and am already  eyeing the 400mm 5.6 Canon lens.
